Articles.Content:
This is a collection of Evitt Industries airliners. We here at Evitt Industries like explosions and booms, so there is no guarantee that your kerbals will not die.![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif) Please do not trust your whole space programs budget on one of these.

The first one we have for you is the E001 Aircruiser. This is actually pretty stable, however pitching up is very sluggish. Seriously, don't fly this thing at mountains.

The next one is the E003 Aircruiser. It has only two engines, but by placing the engines on the tail we have made it less sluggish when you try to pull up. At least, that is what we hoped. It still doesn't pull up well. The next one, the E004, is very similar. The only change is that we lowered the engines to improve the pitch axis.

If the first ones weren't unstable enough, just wait for the later ones. The E005 Aircruiser was more of an experimental plane. And it did not pass the tests. Unfortunately, it would go off the runway and explode before it could take off. If anyone can fix this or tell me how to, I would be very grateful.

The E006 Aircruiser has the same problem as the E005. It runs off the runway and explodes before it takes off. This experimental private jet caused a lot of troubles and drained my space programs budget in career mode. Again, if you could fix this (or any of the other ones) I would be very grateful.

The E007 aircruiser may be slightly insane. It is just a bigger version of the E005, with a lot more engines. Engines are basically the tools engineers use to make bricks fly! This one *also* runs off the runway. I have no idea what causes that. Please, *please* tell me how to fix it.

The E008 Aircruiser was a logical step forward. By centering the engines, the plane is less sluggish. But that's not the case. This plane just explodes.

The final one, the E009, was intended to be supersonic. However, I've never flown it that fast. Be very careful with it.

EDIT: Here is a working picture album on imgur:![SS0UL#10](http://imgur.com/a/SS0UL#10) To open, right click on it and select open in new tab. From right to left, they are E001, E002, E003, E004, E005, E006, E006, E007, E008, E009, E009.

Stuff You Need To See

I would love it if you guys could help me fix these aircraft. But until then, I take no liability for the loss of kerbals. Be careful.

Here is the download link:[https://www./folder/eoczidcce4wwd/Aircruisers](https://www./folder/eoczidcce4wwd/Aircruisers) Tell me if there is a problem with the link or the photos.

 -Alexonaut

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-26T15:36:56Z" title="02/26/2015 03:36  PM" data-short="9 yr">February 26, 2015</time> by Alexonaut**
  
The photos are not showing up.
You need to use the full url for your images when using img tags. None of your pics are showing up.
I think you have parsing for links on and its removing the images

What is wrong with the pictures? How are you supposed to post the pictures? Do they have to be on the internet? All I did was type the name of the picture on my computer and add .png. I would be very thankful if you guys could help me. I'm a very new to the forums. Is the download working?

To post pictures they need to be on the internet first. There are several programs you can use to upload photos on the internet, I'd recommend looking them up on google and picking which one is best for you. Alternatively, if you have a steam account, you could upload them as artwork there, or just take the screenshots using Steam's screenshot key.
